update.description:
This changes the behavior of the Wind Plugin to parameterize the non-realisitic mass based force to default to zero. If the mass based force is approximately zero it skips processing. 

There was also a bug where the vertical wind speed was cross coupled with the horizontal wind speed. That has been fixed, and the vertical wind speed has it's own parameters and noise support.
update.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

pull_request.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

pullrequest.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

content.raw:
Changes look good to me. 

Just one note: it changes existing plugin behavior so we may want to either:

1. update the [Migration](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8a59b5f0f0b9bda21ee905098b47900da492ba9c/Migration.md?at=default) guide about the change to default behavior in WindPlugin and make a note about the new `force_approximation_scaling_factor` sdf element.  

1. set `force_approximation_scaling_factor` default value to 1.0 to maintain compatibility, and let poeple wanting to this plugin with `LiftDragPlugin` add the `force_approximation_scaling_factor` sdf element themselves.  

I can make the change when we agree on which option to take.
content.html:
Changes look good to me.

Just one note: it changes existing plugin behavior so we may want to either:

  1. update the Migration guide about the change to default behavior in WindPlugin and make a note about the new force_approximation_scaling_factor sdf element.

  2. set force_approximation_scaling_factor default value to 1.0 to maintain compatibility, and let poeple wanting to this plugin with LiftDragPlugin add the force_approximation_scaling_factor sdf element themselves.

I can make the change when we agree on which option to take.

pull_request.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

pullrequest.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

content.raw:
I'm not sure there's any way to implement this w/o breaking ABI. I guess there's two approaches. One would be to simply target this for gazebo9. The other is to make a duplicate Wind Plugin. 

And lastly this seems to suggest that we should strongly recommend a pimpl pattern for plugin development to allow more flexibility.
content.html:
I'm not sure there's any way to implement this w/o breaking ABI. I guess there's two approaches. One would be to simply target this for gazebo9. The other is to make a duplicate Wind Plugin.

And lastly this seems to suggest that we should strongly recommend a pimpl pattern for plugin development to allow more flexibility.

pull_request.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

pullrequest.title: Update Wind Plugin to support being used by Lift Drag Plugin

content.raw:
So I just realized that we explicitly link many of the `gazebo_plugins` in `gazebo_ros_pkgs` against plugins hosted upstream in gazebo:

* https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/CMakeLists.txt#L201-L202

So I think it's probably best to be safe and try to maintain ABI for plugins
content.html:
So I just realized that we explicitly link many of the gazebo_plugins in gazebo_ros_pkgs against plugins hosted upstream in gazebo:

  • https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/CMakeLists.txt#L201-L202

So I think it's probably best to be safe and try to maintain ABI for plugins

content.raw:
From this list https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B#The_Do.27s_and_Don.27ts

It looks like you can't add any new members and remain ABI compliant.
content.html:
From this list https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B#The_Do.27s_and_Don.27ts

It looks like you can't add any new members and remain ABI compliant.
